summary: Implement MP3 conversion (FFmpeg.wasm) for in-browser recordings only, triggered on submission actions, while leaving uploaded-file path unchanged.
architectural_notes: MP3 conversion should apply only to in-browser recordings and be triggered on 'Use This Recording' or 'Submit Recording'; uploaded files remain unchanged for now.

existing_features.title: When the user clicks "Use This Recording" in the in-browser recorder, convert the recorded Blob to an MP3 Blob using FFmpeg.wasm at 128kbps CBR, then attach the resulting MP3 as the selected upload file.
Update the FFmpeg conversion helper so the produced MP3 encoding settings are 128kbps CBR (not VBR) and continue returning a Blob with MIME type "audio/mpeg".

When the user clicks "Submit Recording", ensure the submission uses the MP3 produced from in-browser recordings (as specified), while leaving the uploaded-file flow unchanged (uploaded files are submitted as-is).

new_feature_requests.summary: Convert in-browser recorded audio Blob to MP3 (FFmpeg.wasm, 128kbps CBR) on 'Use This Recording' / 'Submit Recording', replacing upload file with MP3 Blob and setting filename/mimeType; do not alter uploaded-file flow

projectName: Convert in-browser recordings to MP3 (FFmpeg.wasm) on attach/submit
